trial_identification.studytitle: Adult stem cells and G-CSF in chronic ischaemic heart disease
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Granulocyte colony stimulating factor (G-CSF) in Angina patients with Ischaemic heart disease to stimulate Neovascularisation.

interventions.interventions: Granulocyte colony stimulating factor Subcutaneous Commenced at 4.5 mcg/kg/d Three 5 day cycles (each cycle fortnight apart)
interventions.comparator: Placebo Saline Subcutaneous Three 5 day cycles (each cycle fortnight apart)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of abnormal perfusion segments on adenosine cardiac magnetic resonance imaging

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 1. Myocardial perfusion ratio index on MRI.
2. Angina and quality of life measures (Seattle angina questionnaire)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Canadian class III/IV angina2. Angiographically proven coronary artery disease3. Demonstrable reversible ischaemia on adenosine stress cardiac MRI.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. MI < 3 months2. Unstable angina3. Uncontrolled heart failure. 4. EF < 20%5. Significant (>50%) left main or left main equivalent disease6. Advanced coronary artery bypass graft disease.7. Factors preventing MRI including permanent pacemaker, implantable defibrillator, neurostimulator, severe claustrophobia8. Contraindications to adenosine including high degree heart block, severe bronchospasm.9. Proliferative retinopathy

trial_design.concealment: Patients will be referred by their primary cardiologist. Once enrolled, subjects will be randomised to either G-CSF followed by placebo or Placebo followed by G-CSF therapy. This allocation will be concealed from both patient and the investigator responsible for patient enrolment and subsequent patient reviews. The allocation schedule will be held by Pharmacy.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomisation table
trial_design.designfeatures: Subjects and the doctors in direct contact with subjects will be blinded.

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Nexia Court & Company Level 29 Australia Square 264 George St, Sydney
Perpetual Foundation GPO Box 4172, Sydney NSW

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: The Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Angina is a medical term used to describe pain (usually felt in the chest) due to coronary artery disease causing reduced blood flow to the heart. We are investigating the use of G-CSF to treat chronic angina in patients who have failed standard treatment with medications and or coronary stenting/coronary artery bypass surgery. G-CSF is a man made version of a naturally occuring hormone. There is experimental evidence that G-CSF can stimulate the formation of new blood vessels in the heart and protect heart muscle cells. Through these effects, we hypothesise that patients will derive improvements in blood flow to the heart and hence angina symptoms. We will be measuring the effects of G-CSF on blood flow to the heart with cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI scan).

ethicscommitee.ethicname: St Vincent's Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee
